title: American man reveals Indian CEO took over a firm, booted out founders, hired Indians. Post goes viral amid - The Economic Times
summary:

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] | Source: [Insert Source Here]

The discourse surrounding Indian immigrants in the U.S. technology sector has intensified due to a viral post accusing an Indian CEO of mismanagement and biased hiring practices.

  • The post claims the CEO ousted original founders and replaced them with Indian executives.
  • Allegations include using the COVID-19 pandemic to implement pay cuts and halt promotions.
  • 15% of the workforce was laid off, with experienced employees disproportionately affected.
  • Outsourcing of work to India disrupted company culture and client satisfaction.

title: Housing supply up 44 pc in NCR this year to 53K units; luxury home share in launches 60 pc: Anarock | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Housing supply up 44 pc in NCR this year to 53K units; luxury home share in launches 60 pc: Anarock

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Anarock

This year, the Delhi-NCR housing market experienced a remarkable 44% growth in new housing supply, amounting to 53,000 units, with a substantial share being ultra-luxury homes.

  • The number of new residential property launches totaled 36,735 units in 2023.
  • Ultra-luxury homes, priced above ₹2.5 crore, constituted nearly 60% of the new supply.
  • Sales in the Delhi-NCR market declined by 6% to 61,900 units compared to the previous year.
  • Overall housing launches in seven major Indian cities saw a 7% decrease.
  • The total sales across these seven cities also saw a marginal decline of 4% this year.
  • Anarock's Chairman noted that elections and slowed project approvals affected new housing supply.
Anarock Chairman Anuj Puri stated, "2024 has been a mixed bag for the Indian housing sector... sales also saw a marginal decline... offset by a 16 percent jump in the overall sales value."

In conclusion, despite the challenges posed by the economic environment, the luxury segment remains resilient, indicating a shift in consumer preferences in the housing market.
newTitle: Housing Supply Sees 44% Increase in NCR This Year, Luxury Homes Dominate

title: Year Ender 2024: Big ticket investments boosts Tamil Nadu's USD 1 trillion dream - CNBCTV18
summary:
Tamil Nadu's 2024 Progress Towards a $1 Trillion Economy

Publication Date: 2024

Source: [Insert Source Here]

Tamil Nadu made significant strides in 2024 to achieve its ambitious goal of a USD 1 trillion economy by 2030, driven by major investments and strategic policies initiated by the DMK government.

  • The state hosted its first Global Investors Meet (GIM) in January 2024, securing ₹6.64 lakh crore in investment commitments that could create 26 lakh jobs.
  • Significant investments include ₹16,000 crore from VinFast for a manufacturing facility, generating 20,000 jobs, and ₹9,000 crore from Tata Motors for electric vehicle production.
  • Chief Minister MK Stalin engaged with international investors, signing multiple MoUs in the US and Spain totaling ₹7,618 crore in commitments, leading to the creation of 12,000 jobs.
  • The government focused on boosting the electric vehicle sector by exploring charging infrastructure along major roads.
  • Mini-TIDEL Parks will be established to extend IT sector benefits to smaller towns, each accommodating around 500 IT professionals.
  • Political analyst Sumanth Raman highlighted the need for greater transparency regarding investment commitments with a public dashboard.
“It is the easiest thing to do (to set up a dashboard). But the government has not done it.” - Sumanth Raman

2024 was a key year for Tamil Nadu as it positioned itself for future economic growth amid ongoing efforts to strengthen investor relations and local job creation.
newTitle: Tamil Nadu's 2024 Progress Towards a $1 Trillion Economy

As we enter 2025, the growing preference for Systematic Investment Plans (SIPs) in the Indian mutual fund industry continues to gain momentum. Despite market volatility, SIPs are recognized for their ease of use and steady returns, making them a popular choice for long-term wealth accumulation.

  • SIPs allow disciplined investments of small sums every month.
  • They are highly effective for long-term investments due to compounding and rupee cost averaging.
  • SIPs help smooth out portfolio returns even during market fluctuations.
  • Experts suggest that SIPs encourage saving and investing habits, beneficial for long-term goals like retirement.

“SIPs are notable because their investments are profitable despite the high market fluctuations.” - Siddharth Maurya, Founder & Managing Director of Vibhavangal Anukulakara Private Limited

Looking ahead, SIPs are set to remain relevant for individuals aiming to invest for the long term.

title: CTC vs in-hand salary: Here’s how to read components of your pay slip. A step-by-step guide | Mint - Mint
summary:
CTC vs in-hand salary: Here’s how to read components of your pay slip. A step-by-step guide

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Live Mint

Understanding the elements that comprise your earnings, such as your gross income, Cost to Company (CTC), and take-home pay, is essential for negotiating your salary and managing your finances.

  • Basic Salary: The fixed amount paid, forming the basis for other benefits.
  • House Rent Allowance (HRA): A tax-free benefit to assist with rent, typically 40%-50% of base pay.
  • Leave Travel Allowance (LTA): Covers domestic travel expenses, tax-exempt with conditions.
  • Special Allowance: Performance-linked and fully taxable.
  • Mobile and Internet Allowance: Covers work-related internet and phone costs, tax-exempt if incurred officially.
  • Food Allowance: Provided for meal expenses during work hours.
  • Conveyance Allowance: Covers commuting expenses.
  • Professional Tax: Location-specific state tax.
  • Employee Provident Fund (EPF): Retirement savings scheme with 12% contribution from both employee and employer.
  • Tax Deducted at Source (TDS): Tax deducted based on income slab.
newTitle: Understanding Your Pay Slip: CTC vs In-Hand Salary
